availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Henry Qualls (Hopkins County, Ky, farm laborer )

body.p: Granville County, North Carolina, and Hopkins County, Kentucky, farm laborer. North Carolina native. Son of James Qualls and Judy Qualls. Student in Granville County, North Carolina, in 1850. Farm laborer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, North Carolina, Granville County, Fort Creek, p. 116B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 617.
"James H. Qualls (1836-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #96204663, accessed September 23, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/96204663.
